name: Naples
fun_fact: Fun fact: Naples invented pizza - and traditional Neapolitan pizza is now UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage! The original Pizza Margherita was created in 1889 for Queen Margherita with tomato, mozzarella, and basil representing the Italian flag!

hero_dishes.name: Pizza Margherita
hero_dishes.description: The original pizza - San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil, olive oil
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created in 1889 by Raffaele Esposito for Queen Margherita of Italy
hero_dishes.where_to_find: L'Antica Pizzeria da Michele, Sorbillo, Di Matteo

hero_dishes.name: Pizza Fritta
hero_dishes.description: Fried pizza dough stuffed with ricotta, cicoli (pork cracklings), and provola
hero_dishes.origin_story: Centuries-old street food born when oven fuel was scarce

hero_dishes.name: Sfogliatella
hero_dishes.description: Multi-layered crispy 'lobster tail' pastry with sweet ricotta filling
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented by nuns in a 17th century convent
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Attanasio near station (always fresh and warm)

hero_dishes.name: Cuoppo
hero_dishes.description: Paper cone of mixed fried foods - croquettes, zeppoline, arancini, pasta fritters
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Neapolitan street food perfect for walking
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Friggitorie on Via dei Tribunali and Spaccanapoli

signature_drinks.name: Espresso
signature_drinks.description: Naples has its own coffee culture - stronger and sweeter than north
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Standing at the bar, with sugar, sometimes with a glass of water

signature_drinks.name: Limoncello
signature_drinks.description: Lemon liqueur made from Amalfi Coast lemons
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ice cold as digestivo after meals

food_culture_notes: Via dei Tribunali and Via San Gregorio Armeno are street food heaven
'Fried is better' is the Naples rule
Frittatina di pasta - fried pasta cake - is apotheosis of Neapolitan street food
Taralli (savory rings) eaten as snacks since the 1700s
